If parameters is non-null, the name-value pairs will be appended to the QUERY STRING while the content is sent in the request BODY. This is not a common use case and is therefore not represented in the post() methods in AbstractRestClient or AsyncRestClient, but is nevertheless possible using this constructor
member.param: Optional name-value pairs to be appended to QUERY STRING

member.name: M:Smsgh.Api.Sdk.Smsgh.MessagingApi.GetMessages(System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve messages. Upon success it return a list of messages. However one can provide some filters to narrow down the query.
member.param: The number of results to skip from the result set. The default is 0.
The maximum number of results to return. This has a hard limit of 100 messages.
A true or false value used to indicate if only scheduled messages should be returned in the result set. By default only sent message are returned.
Used to filter the result by the direction of the message. Possible values are "in" (to return only inbound messages) and "out" (to return only outbound messages).

member.name: M:Smsgh.Api.Sdk.Smsgh.StringUtil.IsValidTime(System.String)
member.summary: Time validation, determines if the string passed is a valid time. Validates times as 12hr or 24hr (HH:MM) or am/pm ([H]H:MM[a|p]m) Matches times separated by either : or . will match a 24 hour time, or a 12 hour time with AM or PM specified. Allows 0-59 minutes, and 0-59 seconds. Seconds are not required.

member.name: M:Smsgh.Api.Sdk.Smsgh.StringUtil.IsPhoneNumber(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Checks that a value is a valid phone number The format used is either: - ITU-T E.164 standard format which is for instance : +233247063817. According to ITU-T E.164 phone number are not mor than 15 characters. or - EPP format which is : +CCC.NNNNNNNNNNxEEEE where C is the 1-3 digit country code, N is up to 14 digits, and E is the (optional) extension.
member.param: The possible values are ITU and EPP . The default value is ITU

member.name: M:Smsgh.Api.Sdk.Smsgh.StringUtil.IsPhoneNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Check whether a string is a valid phone number

member.name: M:Smsgh.Api.Sdk.Smsgh.StringUtil.IsValidDate(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validates a datetime value. All values matching the "date" core validation rule, and the "time" one will be valid format. The possible formats to pass to the function are : dmy 05-12-2011 or 05-12-11 separators can be a space, period, dash, forward slash mdy 12-05-2011 or 12-05-11 separators can be a space, period, dash, forward slash ymd 2011-12-05 or 11-12-05 separators can be a space, period, dash, forward slash dMy 05 December 2011 or 05 Dec 2011 Mdy December 05, 2011 or Dec 05, 2011 comma is optional My December 2011 or Dec 2011 my 12/2011 separators can be a space, period, dash, forward slash

member.name: M:Smsgh.Api.Sdk.Smsgh.StringUtil.IsValidTimeAs24H(System.String)
member.summary: Time validation, determines if the string passed is a valid time. Validates time as 24hr (HH:MM) or am/pm ([H]H:MM[a|p]m) Does not allow/validate seconds.

member.name: M:Smsgh.Api.Sdk.Smsgh.StringUtil.IsValidDateTime(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validates a datetime value. All values matching the "date" core validation rule, and the "time" one will be valid format. The possible formats to pass to the function are : dmy 05-12-2011 or 05-12-11 separators can be a space, period, dash, forward slash mdy 12-05-2011 or 12-05-11 separators can be a space, period, dash, forward slash ymd 2011-12-05 or 11-12-05 separators can be a space, period, dash, forward slash dMy 05 December 2011 or 05 Dec 2011 Mdy December 05, 2011 or Dec 05, 2011 comma is optional My December 2011 or Dec 2011 my 12/2011 separators can be a space, period, dash, forward slash

member.name: M:Smsgh.Api.Sdk.Smsgh.StringUtil.IsEqual(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if both strings are equal to each other. Safely handles the case where either string may be null. The strings are evaluated as equal if they are both null or if they actually equal each other. One string that is null while the other one isn't (even if its an empty string) will be considered as NOT equal. Case sensitive comparisons are optional.
